intro: Aframomum sanguineum, commonly known as red cardamom, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the ginger family (Zingiberaceae) and is characterized by its tall, herbaceous stems and large, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of bright red, fleshy fruits that contain aromatic seeds used in traditional medicine and cuisine. Its botanical features include a rhizomatous root system and showy, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in terminal inflorescences. The plant is valued for its ornamental appeal and medicinal properties.
